Items.Title: Resolution designating May 10 annually as Judith Jamison Day in the City of New York to honor her life and legacy as a dancer, choreographer, and longtime artistic director of the groundbreaking Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Designating May 10 annually as Judith Jamison Day in the City of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing May 10 annually as Chinese American Railroad Workers Memorial Day in New York City
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing May 10 annually as Chinese American Railroad Workers Memorial Day in New York City.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign S.5545/A.885, the Equity in Fertility Treatment Act.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Equity in Fertility Treatment Act (S.5545/A.885)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.705/A.2140, which would cap the amount people pay for non-complicated, routine medical procedures at 150% of the cost paid by Medicare for those same services.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 6 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote negative on this item:
Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Salamanca, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Fair Pricing Act (S.705/A.2140).

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.
Items.AgendaNote: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS - Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to signage describing certain constitutional and legal protections.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Signage describing certain constitutional and legal protections.

Items.Title: Resolution condemning the passage of H.R.29/S.5, also known as the Laken Riley Act, for eroding due process, disconnecting vulnerable immigrants from city services and resources, decreasing trust between immigrants and local law enforcement, facilitating chaos in the immigration system, and instilling fear in immigrant communities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Condemning the passage of the Laken Riley Act (H.R.29/S.5).

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Withdrawn

Items.Title: Land Use
Report of the Committee on Land Use
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON LAND USE

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There were 47 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.

There is presently one vacant seat on the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the Special Election of April 29, 2025 (51st CD, Staten Island).

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Wednesday, May 28, 2025.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Int. No. 762-B,  VOTE: 42-5-0
Negative: Council Members Krishnan, Mealy, Powers, Restler, and Won.

Preconsidered Res. No. 862,  VOTE: 41-6-0
Negative: Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Vernikov, Zhuang, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

See files for individual votes.
